messages: d6a2f9e12804a7ebe70252897c360553 (09:13): Hi, my google page rank has recently went to 0, and i'm trying to use this prediction tool, and it can't determine my future rank. But it can for any other site I try. Any ideas?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:14): complexity: ya, stop what you're doing
d6a2f9e12804a7ebe70252897c360553 (09:16): reisio: Yes. I care about google page rank, that wasn't the question :)
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:16): you can't make Google put your page up
d6a2f9e12804a7ebe70252897c360553 (09:21): If a page has a pr of 0 its usually as a penatly actually
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:22): 'penalty'
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:24): it may be nice if google assigns that same penalty for non-validating pages ;)
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:31): deadroot: they'd have to delist their own pages :p
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:37): "fucking me off", heh
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:39): complexity: i recall of one guy who had his forums losing the rank because somehow a HTTP 404 header was added to his templates
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:39): it was some mouse pet forum, iirc
73ec3a4c73d15344d31bc3f1ec350153 (09:42): I'm having a problem with XHTML and CSS.
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:43): If I use no doctype declaration, FireFox 2.0 RC 2 displays it just fine.
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:43): does it validate?
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:43): However, using the XHTML Transitional doctype, the CSS is not rendered correctly.
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:43): It does validate.
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:44): the CSS doesn't render _how you want it_
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:44): it is most likely rendering correctly
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:44): Okay, I can accept that I suppose.
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:44): piratehead: are you also using the XML prolog?
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:44): deadroot: I don't think I am.
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:44): deadroot: because I do not know what an XML prolog is.
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:45): xml declaration
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:45): before the doctype
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:45): <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1" ?> <- example
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:45): no, I am not using something like that.
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:45): Do you suggest it?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:45): is there _anything_ before your doctype declaration? :p
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:45): Nothing at all.
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:45): clearly there isn't :p
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:45): reisio: there is a point
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:45): otherwise it'd be in quirks mode and he wouldn't have noticed the change
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:46): anyways, where were we
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:46): because in IE6, the XML prolog will trigger quirksmode. so if he fixed for IE6, then it'll bork in Firefox
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:46): piratehead: what's the problem?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:46): mmm, but he said it works how he likes in quirks mode :p
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:46): Right, quirks mode did me well.
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:46): But I want it to be valid XHTML.
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:46): piratehead: right, so what's the problem?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:46): CommandPrompt++
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:47): piratehead: would you mind passing out the URL?
01dfc3bbee6738f38a06f534972e5445 (09:47): what tag can I place inside a anchor that won't mess things up?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:47): CaptainMorgan: so many
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:47): The problem is that I use CSS absolute positioning in order to lay out the page.
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:47): piratehead: neato
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:47): CaptainMorgan: any inline elements
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:47): CaptainMorgan:  <a> no messy <b> be bold</b> </a>
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:47): And using the XHTML 1.0 Transitional doctype declaration, the page displays as if there were no CSS layout.
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:47): piratehead: right right, that's not what the problem is
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:48): piratehead:  url?
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:48): piratehead: URL?!
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:48): a problem is like "hey my box isn't in the right spot"
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:48): and then you paste the URL
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:48): cp, deadroot: the file is local.
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:48): cp, deadroot: should I try to put it up somewhere?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:48): piratehead: paste.css-standards.org
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:49): it'll be easier if we can see what you're looking at. after all there are infinite possibilities
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:49): well, I'll start by just pasting the source then
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:50): alright, it's pasted
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:50): http://paste.css-standards.org/1534
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:51): i see browser detect code
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:51): piratehead--
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:51): yup, there's browser detect code
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:52): it just performs a visual adjustment on load, it ought not affect the CSS I think
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:52): piratehead: read this sometime later: http://hotdesign.com/seybold/everything.html
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:52): I see html and js, and <link> elements, but no .css
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:53): There are <link> elements in the head which contain hrefs to css files.
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:53): reisio: I am not skilled enough with CSS layout to cope without tables yet.
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:53): right
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:53): nice path too :)
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:53): unfortunately, doesn't tell us anything on what the CSS might be
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:54): piratehead: take all your CSS and put it inside a <style type="text/css">your css here </style> within the head and repaste
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:54): mmkay, if it'll help
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:54): maybe I don't write valid CSS? =D
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:54): just put it up and we'll fix it
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:54): we don't have lives
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:55): am I that obvious and transparent?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:55): actually I'm going to the ichetucknee in like six hours :)
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:55): I guess I should as my girlfriends here, Mona and Lisa plus all my friends jumping on the bed, if it's true I have no life
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:56): s/should/&ask
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:58): http://paste.css-standards.org/1535
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:58): css is in now
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:58): thanks for your time by the way, though.
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (09:59): helping somebody who doesn't understand standards is the pits. =P
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:59): armpits?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:59): cuz mine are lethal
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:59): piratehead: you have done well, good paste, GOOD PASTE!
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (10:00): piratehead: okay so what's the problem? :)
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (10:00): check out View as Web Page
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (10:00): it's all scrunched
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (10:00): it ought to be nicely laid out
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (10:00): oh so you don't want it scrunched?
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (10:01): not all on top of each other
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (10:02): k, due to your nonspecificity
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (10:02): you're going to have to read that page I linked you now :/
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (10:03): font-size:12;   12ducks?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (10:03): top:160;  160flamingos?
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (10:03): I fixed those, and it was good!
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (10:03): So, I was very close to spec.
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (10:03): I was just took the CSS for granted.
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (10:04): And when I left quirk-mode it bit me.
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (10:04): Thanks for pointing to that page, reisio.
77d969d952cdf6a332855ab1136e0e2f (10:04): I'll have to give it a better read some time.
